Juliano Lino Ferreira

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/9874158476680094
  • Última atualização do currículo em 04/09/2019

Researcher A of EMBRAPA Southern Livestock - Genetics and Breeding. He holds a diploma in Agriculture and Livestock technician from Escola Agrotécnica Federal de Barbacena (Diaulas Abreu), a degree in Agronomy from Universidade Federal de Lavras (2003) and a Master in Genetics and Breeding from Universidade Federal de Viçosa (2004), and a Doctor Scientia degree in Genetics and Breeding in Universidade Federal de Viçosa / University of California Davis (2009). He also worked as Postdoctoral position at Consórcio Brasileiro de Pesquisa do Café / EMBRAPA Café (BIOAGRO UFV) and EPAMIG Grape and Wine at laboratory of Plant Biotechnology He has experience in Genetics, with emphasis on Molecular Genetics and Microorganisms, working mainly on the following topics: breeding, forage, evolution, domestication, biosafety, molecular markers, genetic diversity, development of microsatellite markers, sequencing, beans, biotic and abiotic stresses and genomic analysis. He also has experience in the areas of Statistics, Biometrics, Population Genetics and Genomic Statistics. e-mails: juliano.ferreira@embrapa.br julianolf@gmail.com juliano2nd@outlook.com julianolf@yahoo.com.br Skype: juliano2nd WhatsApp:+5535991716457 (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2016 - Atual
PC5. Forage Germplasm Banks
Descrição: The Component Project of Active Banks of Forage Germplasm will be coordinated by Embrapa Cattle to house the BAGs of the most used species in the country, in collaboration with Embrapa Genetic Resources and Biotechnology. As part of its mission as coordinator of actions in Genetic Resources. The project involves 13 action plans, one and management of active fodder banks, destinations, eight are specific fodder, ie active Germplasm of Azevém in Embrapa Cattle of Milk, Brachiaria in Embrapa Cattle, capimelefante (BAGCE) and collections of Cynodon and Setaria in the Embrapa Milk Cattle, buffelgrass in the Embrapa Semi-Arid, Desmanthus at Embrapa Tabuleiros Coastlines, Panicum maximum at Embrapa Cattle, Paspalum at Embrapa Southeastern Livestock and Stylosanthes at Embrapa Cattle. The other four banks are regional, which are, Active Bank of Forages of importance for a region Mid North in Embrapa MedioNorte, Active Forage Banks of importance to the Southern Region of Embrapa Pecuária Sul, Active Bank of Forages of importance for the Cerrado in Embrapa Cerrados and Active Bank of Forages of importance to the Pantanal at Embrapa Pantanal. The patient will seek throughout the duration of the same physical exercise and plans, seeking to advance the objectives and the results an interaction between germplasm banks, in the total of two visits to each bank, and make some advice with those responsible for action plans, preferably for Congresses of Genetic Resources, every two years. Through this project, the data of the access passport of Embrapa forage germplasm banks available in the Alelo System by the end of 2016 and the end-of-project characterization data. The accesses are still characterized for the various characteristics until the end the seeds of the accessories are duplicated and stored in Colbase in the long run..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Juliano Lino Ferreira - Integrante / Maurício Marini Köpp - Integrante / Andréa Mittelmann - Integrante / Ana Cristina Mazzocato - Integrante / Liana Jank - Coordenador / Celso Dornelas Fernandes - Integrante / Jose Raul Valerio - Integrante / Fernanda Bortolini - Integrante / Mateus Figueiredo Santos - Integrante / Allan Kardec Braga Ramos - Integrante / Alessandra Pereira Favero - Integrante / Ana Veruska Cruz da Silva Muniz - Integrante / Antônio Vander Pereira - Integrante / Ana Clara de Souza Meirelles - Integrante / Andrea Beatriz Mendes Bonato - Integrante / Balbina Maria Araújo Soriano - Integrante / Bianca Baccili Zanotto Vigna - Integrante / Cacilda Borges do Valle - Integrante / Flávio Rodrigo Gandolfi Benites - Integrante / João Batista Garcia - Integrante / José Francisco Montenegro Valls - Integrante / José Henrique de Abulquerque Rangel - Integrante / José Nilton Moreira - Integrante / Juarez Campolina - Integrante / Maria Aparecida Carvalhaes - Integrante / Paulo Sarmanho da Costa Lima - Integrante / Rafaela Priscila Antônio - Integrante / Raimundo Bezerra de Araújo Neto - Integrante / Rosângela Maria Simeão Resende - Integrante / Sandra Aparecida Santos - Integrante / Sânzio Carvalho Lima Barrios - Integrante / Vânia Cristina Renno Azevedo - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Empresa Brasileira de Pesquisa Agropecuária - Auxílio financeiro.
2015 - Atual
Development of Panicum maximum cultivars for the diversification, sustainability and intensification of pastures
Descrição: Development of Panicum maximum cultivars for the diversification, sustainability and intensification of pastures( leafhoppers , foliar and seed fungi , viruses and nematodes ) and abiotic (efficiency in the use of phosphorus, in agricultural integration and on the response to fertilization and leaf anatomy); evaluation of selected genotypes in VCU trials cuts and grazing for commercial launch. During the life of the project, two cultivars will be launched commercially and one is being finalized for launch. As an innovative proposal, the project includes several approaches of selection of genotypes for drought tolerance, activities to determine the critical level of P in the soil and the use of fungi endophytes to increase the resistance of the existing cultivars and the cultivars to be launched, as well as selection of models for genotypic values prediction based on SNPs obtained via "genotyping by sequencing "(GBS). development of molecular techniques to help in future the genetic , ie, mapping of the species to production loci, quality and resistance to leaf fungus Bipolaris maydis, development of a protocol for the regeneration, synthesis and study of nanoparticles for the release of DNA within cells , and the characterization of genes related to the cell wall lignification process and identification of forms homologues of these genes specifically linked to fiber quality due to maturity in the species..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Juliano Lino Ferreira - Integrante / Liana Jank - Coordenador / Anete Pereira de Souza - Integrante / Beatriz Lempp - Integrante / Celso Dornelas Fernandes - Integrante / Francisco Duarte Fernandes - Integrante / Francisco Jose da Silva Ledo - Integrante / Giovana Alcantara Maciel - Integrante / Jaqueline Rosemeire Verzignassi - Integrante / Jose Raul Valerio - Integrante / Karem Guimaraes Xavier Meireles - Integrante / Luis Felipe Prada e Silva - Integrante / Marlene de Barros Coelho - Integrante / Rodrigo Amorim Barbosa - Integrante / Valdemir Antonio Laura - Integrante / Vera Tavares De Campos Carneiro - Integrante / Giselle Mariano Lessa de Assis - Integrante / Lucimara Chiari - Integrante / Mateus Figueiredo Santos - Integrante / Fabrícia Zimermann Vilela Torres - Integrante / Gisele Olivas de Campos Leguizamon - Integrante / Allan Kardec Braga Ramos - Integrante / Bruno Carneiro e Pedreira - Integrante / Patrícia Menezes Santos - Integrante / Alexandre Romeiro de Araújo - Integrante / Roberto Giolo de Almeida - Integrante / Gustavo José Braga - Integrante / Newton de Lucena Costa - Integrante / Frederico de Pina Matta - Integrante / Luice Gomes Bueno - Integrante / Haroldo Pires de Queiroz - Integrante / Janaína Azevedo Martuscello - Integrante / Edson Espíndola Cardoso - Integrante / Erno Suhre - Integrante / Dalizia Montenário de Aguiar - Integrante / Luís Antônio Dias Leal - Integrante / Carlos Augusto de Miranda Gomide - Integrante / Patrícia Gomes Cardoso - Integrante / Gessi Cecon - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Empresa Brasileira de Pesquisa Agropecuária - Auxílio financeiro.
2015 - Atual
Genetic improvement of native forages in the south of Brazil Acronym: NATSUL
Descrição: The fields of southern Brazil are distributed among the states of Paraná, Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul, in the Mata biomes Atlantic and Pampa. Its vegetation presents a high diversity of species and constitutes an important fodder resource contributing 77% of the slaughtered cattle. The replacement of rural areas by agricultural and / or forestry crops and inadequate grazing management strategies drastically reduced the field area in southern Brazil with consequent decrease in production capacity of the fields, resulting in the formation of extensive degraded areas. In this context, a of the major problems of livestock farming in the South of Brazil is the scarcity of forage species cultivars more adapted to this Region and mainly of natives that are totally non existent. This proposal gives continuity to the project "Valorization and of natural resources in the southern Brazilian for sustainable livestock production and recovery of native pastures degraded in the Bioma Pampa "and is foreseen in the Arrangement" Genetic improvement and seed production of fodder for southern region of Brazil ". The use of the biodiversity of the southern Brazilian fields and their transfer to the producers in the form of cultivars that can be traded for livestock production with native species and linking their use to other functions as the recovery and maintenance of degraded areas (recovery of ecosystem production function) provide socioeconomic and environmental gains of great impact for the national livestock. In this context the project has the objective of main developing cultivars of native species of Brazilian southern fields. The project will be developed in partnership with Embrapa / CPPSUL, Embrapa / CPACT and Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul. The species to be studied are: Grasses - Paspalum guenoarum , P. notatum , P. lepton , P. urvillei , P. dilatatum , P. pumilum and legumes Ornithopus micranthus , Vicia angustifolia, Macroptilium lathyroides and Vigna luteola . The species are in different stages of breeding, because some of them have been worked on by the proposal team for the longest time, so the project foresees phase activities initial and final stages of improvement throughout the project period, characterizing the continuity of actions for future launches of new cultivars. The project is divided into six Action Plans: Action Plan 1 - technical and financial management the Project; PA 2 - carry out actions aimed at obtaining and expansion of genetic variability; PA 3 - lead study evaluation and selection of lineages obtained from work collections and inter- and intra- specific crosses ; PA 4 - will evaluate accessions of the work collections and / or the new developed strains and cultivars developed with regard to aspects Specific management, quality, abiotic stress, seeds, etc .; PA 5 - carry out the tests required by network Ministry of Agriculture Livestock and Supply (MAPA) for the registration and protection of cultivars and their respective routing; PA 6 - will make the production of gene - seed and its availability to the crops effectively are inserted in the productive systems. The lack of native cultivars and information and / or dissemination of the potential use of these species and their associated benefits has led to the adoption of inadequate alternatives, such as the use of few exotic species, inadequate management or indiscriminate expansion of crop areas or forest. Based on the results obtained in this project, expect in general: i) Provide forage alternatives for species diversification cultivated in the southern Brazilian fields and ii ) Provide subsidies for sustained management and productive maintenance of the southern fields Brazilians ..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Juliano Lino Ferreira - Integrante / Maurício Marini Köpp - Coordenador / Ana Cristina Mazzocato - Integrante / Daniel Portella Montardo - Integrante / Gustavo Trentin - Integrante / João Carlos Pinto Oliveira - Integrante / Miguel Dall?Agnol - Integrante / MARCIA CRISTINA TEIXEIRA DA SILVEIRA - Integrante / DANILO MENEZES SANTANNA - Integrante / Carine Simioni - Integrante / Fernanda Bortolini - Integrante / Gustavo Martins da Silva - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Empresa Brasileira de Pesquisa Agropecuária - Auxílio financeiro.
2013 - 2015
Valuation and use of natural resources of the South Brazilian fields for sustainable livestock production and recovery of degraded native pastures in the Pampa Biome
Descrição: The fields of southern Brazil are distributed among the states of Paraná, Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul, in the Mata biomes Atlantic and Pampa. Its vegetation presents a high diversity of species and constitutes an important fodder resource contributing 77% of the slaughtered cattle. Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Juliano Lino Ferreira - Integrante / Maurício Marini Köpp - Coordenador / Andréa Mittelmann - Integrante / Ana Cristina Mazzocato - Integrante / Gustavo Trentin - Integrante / MARCIA CRISTINA TEIXEIRA DA SILVEIRA - Integrante / DANILO MENEZES SANTANNA - Integrante / Sérgio de Oliveira Juchem - Integrante / Leandro Bochi da Silva Volk - Integrante / José Pedro Pereira Trindade - Integrante / Jorge Luiz Sant'Anna dos Santos - Integrante / Carine Simioni - Integrante / Antonio Carlos Ferreira da Silva - Integrante / Fernanda Bortolini - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado do Rio Grande do Sul - Auxílio financeiro.
2011 - 2015
Development of Panicum maximum cultivars for diversification and intensification of pastures
Descrição: Cattle breeding in Brazil is based on the use of pastures, but has few forages of high production, with good distribution of fodder throughout the year, and adapted to the different ecological conditions of the country. In the search for new forages, Embrapa Gado de Corte imported the international collection of Panicum maximum representative of the natural variability of the species and that includes apomictic accesses and sexual plants that allow the genetic improvement. This project is the continuation of the macroprogram project 2 "Obtaining new cultivars of Panicum maximum for diversification and intensification of Brazilian pastures "developed between 2007 and 2010. This project involved the evaluation of 400 hybrids in the field, still in progress, the selection of genotypes for tolerance to biotic and abiotic stresses, and the implantation of the development of molecular markers for the species, the molecular characterization of the germplasm , the prospection of liginine synthesis genes , the cytogenetic characterization and determination of the foliar anatomy of promising genotypes. aims to give continuity to the activities of the previous project, evaluation of the hybrids in the field and the VCU trials.The project aims, to develop, through genetic improvement and selection, genotypes of P. maximum that meet the diverse demands of the productive chains of beef and sheep. The project consists of five action plans, one of management. In the second, pre -improvement activities are added to improve breeding efficiency and future genetic transformation work. The analysis of the variability of hybrids, mapping of the species, search of genes involved in resistance to Bipolaris maydis and lignification, accelerated breeding and regeneration of the species by in vitro culture for future transgenic work. Improvement activities are in action plan 3 and include the agronomic and reproductive evaluation of hybrids already in the field, evaluation of selected hybrids in a national network trial at six sites, and generation of new hybrids by directed crosses and evaluation of these hybrids. In action plan 4 are the selection activities of promising genotypes tolerant to biotic stresses (leafhoppers and leaf and seed diseases) and abiotic stresses (fertilization test, P utilization efficiency, Al tolerance, drought tolerance, In the action plan 5 are the VCU trials and seed production aimed at commercial release, with experiments involving five genotypes evaluated in four experiments: one with three genotypes under grazing ovine-bovine intercalated, two under (GD) and two in the Amazonian biome (AC). This project is expected to indicate the commercial launch of two genotypes, and thus contribute to the diversification of pastures and increase of animal productivity in tropical areas of Brazil and, consequently, reduce the pressure for opening new areas..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (5) / Doutorado: (2) .
